patterns: How is the curriculum for computing like?

NUS com curriculum?
What is the curriculum structure in nus computing?
How is the curriculum structure in NUS computing?
What is the curriculum structure in nus comp?
How is the curriculum structure in NUS com?
responses:
For a single degree, you will have to complete 160 modular credits (MC) and for a double degree, you will have to complete around 200 MC. The 160 MC is broken down into: 20 MC for University Level Requirements, 72 MC for Core Modules, 24 MC for Elective Modules,12 MC for Dissertation or Industry Internship Programme and the remaining 32MC is for Unrestricted Electives (UE). For poly-intake, 20MC is automatically awarded for UE.

For more information, please visit https://www.comp.nus.edu.sg/programmes/

responses:
The criteria for degree classification is as follows: Honours (Highest Distinction): CAP 4.50 and above Honours (Distinction): CAP 4.00 – 4.49 Honours (Merit): CAP 3.50 – 3.99 Honours: CAP 3.00 – 3.49 Pass: CAP 2.00 – 2.99

For more information, please visit http://www.nus.edu.sg/registrar/academic-information-policies/undergraduate-students/continuation-and-graduation-requirements

patterns: What is the outcome of my application
When will i know the outcome of my application
How can i check my application outcome
How will i know if my application is successful
application outcome
how do i know if my application is unsuccessful
responses: Applicants will be informed of the outcome of their application for admission via our Online Application Status Facility (OASF). The admission e-letter is an official document, downloadable from the OASF, stating your admission application outcome. The University will not be sending outcome letter by post (unless stated) or email informing the application outcome. Details are provided at http://www.nus.edu.sg/oam/accept-reject-offer

patterns: What is aptitude-based admissions
Ways to enter NUS besides grades
aptitude based admission
is there other ways of entering nus
aptitude based application
can i apply to nus without grades
responses:
The University sets aside up to 15% of university places for consideration of exceptional candidates for admission. For such students who do not met the cut-off points for the course applied to, the University will consider other factors besides academic grades. These students may be admitted on other bases, including demonstrated ability and interest, work experience, leadership, community service and exceptional talent, subject to a minimum level of academic competence.

For more information, please visit https://www.askadmissions.nus.edu.sg/app/answers/detail/a_id/176

patterns: How to apply to NUS
When can I apply to NUS
When does the application window open
When do i apply for admission to NUS
application window
when is the application window
responses:
Application for admission to NUS undergraduate courses opens in mid-October each year with different closing dates for different applicant category/qualification. Applications must be submitted online through the Admissions website.

More details can be found at https://www.askadmissions.nus.edu.sg/app/answers/detail/a_id/756

patterns: How do i rank the choice of course I wish to be considered?
how do i rank my courses choices
ranking of course choices
how can i rank my course choices
responses:
Applicants will be considered for admission based on their preferred course choices ranked from first to last choice, ie. if an applicant does not meet the admission criteria for his first choice, he will be considered for his second choice and so on.

For more information regarding exclusions to the above, please visit https://www.askadmissions.nus.edu.sg/app/answers/detail/a_id/86

patterns: Request early application outcome

I have received an offer of admission from another university and has to accept it before NUS is able to inform me of my application outcome by end May.  Can I request an early outcome from NUS to make an informed decision?
when do i know the outcome of my early application
outcome of my early application
responses: Most applicants will receive the outcome of their application for admission to NUS by mid-May. Regardless whether you have accepted/enrolled in other universities, NUS will still process your application and inform you of the outcome between late April and May (those who have attended test/interviews for Architecture, Industrial Design, Landscape Architecture, Law, Medicine, Dentistry and Nursing will receive their outcome in May). All local applicants will accept their offers online via the common acceptance webpage from January to late May (please refer to https://myaces.nus.edu.sg/uasonline/Login for latest updates on the common acceptance closing date every year).

patterns: What are the minimum marks to get into NUS
What are the minimum marks to secure admission into NUS
How high must my score be to enter NUS
Can a low score enter NUS
what is the minimum scored required to enter NUS
responses: Admission to the university is based on academic merit and open competition among the applicant cohort. The admission criteria vary from year to year depending on the competitiveness of the applicant cohort. Therefore, there is no fixed minimum marks/grades to secure admission. Potential applicants may refer to the Indicative Grade Profile (http://www.nus.edu.sg/oam/undergraduate-programmes/indicative-grade-profile-(igp)) and course places of the previous academic year to make more informed choices when applying for admission.

patterns: I have been offered a course already, can i still change my course
Can I appeal to change to another course after I have been offered a place
appeal for a change of course
can i appeal to change my course
can i change course after being offered
can i still change my course after accepting
responses:
Yes, you can. However, appeals to Architecture, Dentistry, Industrial Design, Landscape Architecture, any Law-related courses, Medicine and Nursing will not be considered, unless you have taken the required aptitude tests and interviews conducted earlier.

For appeals procedures, please visit http://www.nus.edu.sg/oam/apply-to-nus/after-you-apply/submit-appeals

Can i appeal to get my first choice

responses: The office of admission has considered all of your choices, in order of your preference. If you had satisfied the requirement for the courses listed you would have been offered one of those courses. Therefore, it is highly unlikely for the University to grant you admission to your first or second choice of course as a result of your appeal.

patterns: I am a full-time National Serviceman. What must I do after accepting the offer of admission to a course?
What must nsfs do after accepting offer to nus
i am a nsmen and i just accepted the offer to nus
i am a nsf that just accepted the offer to nus
as a nsf is there anything i need to do after accepting the offer from nus
responses: The University will write to you in October of the year before your enrolment to NUS. You will be requested to confirm your acceptance of the reserved course via our online system and select one of the following enrolment options: 1)  Enrolling in August for the Academic Year, 2)  Unable to enrol due to National, Service commitments, AND request for deferment of course to next Academic Year, 3)  Unable to enrol due to National Service commitment BUT I would like to obtain a letter from NUS so that I can apply for disruption to enrol in the current Academic Year, 4)  Rejecting place in NUS

patterns: I was not offered a course, should i appeal for the same courses or should i appeal for different courses
Should i appeal for a different course
can i appeal for the same courses
can i appeal for the course which i was not offered
responses: You have already been considered for all your previous choices. If you were not offered a place, it is because you did not meet the admission and/or subject requirements for all your choices. Therefore, appealing for the same choices would be highly unlikely to change the University's prior decision. You are strongly encouraged to appeal for courses other than your previous choices.

patterns: Can a nsf re-apply to NUS
how do i reapply
how can i reapply
reapplication for a course in nus
reapplication to nus
reapply for another course
re-apply for another course
responses:
If you wish to re-apply for admission to another course at NUS, you may submit a fresh application for admission during the application period. Please refer to the application period pertaining to your qualification at http://www.nus.edu.sg/oam/apply-to-nus.html You should only indicate the course(s) that you wish to be considered.

For more information, please visit http://www.nus.edu.sg/oam/apply-to-nus/returning-national-servicemen/information-for-full-time-ns-men

patterns: How is one selected for admission to a course in NUS?
How is the selection procedure like
How will i be selected for a course
What is the selection procedure like
nus selection process
admission selection process
responses:
Admission is based on academic merit and open competition among all eligible applicants for places available. Academic merit is used to determine admission for non-interview courses and a minimum academic proficiency is still required for students considered under Aptitude Based Admissions. For admission to Architecture, Dentistry, Industrial Design, Landscape Architecture, Medicine, Nursing, any Law-related courses and some Double/Concurrent Degree Programmes, it is also dependent on the outcome of interviews and/or aptitude tests (please check the respective faculty website for the specific requirements).

For more information, please refer to https://www.askadmissions.nus.edu.sg/app/answers/detail/a_id/83

patterns: Nus scholarship interview
When and how will the selection interviews for the NUS Scholarships be conducted
When will nus scholarship results be released
What is the selection process of the nus scholarship like
scholarship selection process
what is the selection process like for nus scholarship
responses:
Selection interviews for the NUS Scholarships (for Singapore Citizens) will be conducted from March to May each year. Shortlisted applicants will be invited specifically for scholarship selection interviews. Applicants who are shortlisted will be notified of their interview details through email. Applicants will be informed of the outcome of their application for scholarships via the Online Application Status Facility (OASF) by end-May. The scholarship e-letter is an official document, downloadable from the OASF, stating your scholarship application outcome. No other outcome letter will be posted to you.

For more information, please refer to https://www.askadmissions.nus.edu.sg/app/answers/detail/a_id/807

patterns: Does NUS offer part time undergraduate degree courses
part time undergraduate degree courses
part time degree
part-time undergraduate degree courses
part-time degree
parttime undergraduate degree courses
parttime degree
does nus offer part time degree
does nus offer parttime degree
responses: Yes, part-time undergraduate courses such as the Bachelor of Technology (Engineering/Computing) programmes are offered by our School of Continuing and Lifelong Education (SCALE), please refer to http://scale.nus.edu.sg/programmes/btech.html for more information.

patterns: How do i submit supporting documents
submit supporting documents online
submission of supporting documents online
responses: All applicants are required to submit their supporting documents electronically through the 'Online Submission of Supporting Document' option when they login to the Online Application Status Facility (OASF). An Application Checklist is available in the respective application category (http://www.nus.edu.sg/oam/apply-to-nus.html) to guide you on document submission. You are not required to mail or fax your documents after you have submitted your documents electronically. You may login to the OASF 3-5 working days after electronic submission to check if your supporting documents have been received. Submitting your supporting documents via the OASF will save time and cost, and speed up the processing of your application.

patterns: can i defer my studies
deferring studies
will nus reserve a place for me if i defer my studies
gap year programme
does nus offer a gap year
responses: Currently, we do not offer a gap year programme.  Places will ONLY be reserved for applicants serving full-time National Service (NS) in Singapore as they are required to complete their NS liability before pursuing tertiary education. However, for extenuating circumstances such as a medical condition that prevents the successful applicant from enrolling with us, the applicant should submit an appeal to the Office of Admissions for consideration. You should apply for University admission in the year you are ready to enroll.

patterns: How do the SU system works
What is the SU grading options
What can I su
what does the SU work
How do su work
what is su
responses:
At the end of the semester, letter grades for modules will be released to students. Under the S/U mechanism, students may choose to retain the letter grade and have it factored into their CAP, or choose to exercise the S/U option on a module, in which case the letter grade will not be shown on the transcript nor computed towards the CAP. A ‘S' grade is assigned if the student receives a ‘C' grade or above for the module. Conversely, the student will receive a ‘U' if the grade obtained is lower than a ‘C' grade. Modular credits will be earned only if a ‘Satisfactory' (S) grade is attained.

For more information, please visit http://www.nus.edu.sg/registrar/academic-activities/satisfactory-unsatisfactory-(s-u)-option

patterns: how are the modules allocated
why did i not get the module i bid for

how are the modules being allocated
how come i did not get the module i bid for
responses: ModReg@EduRec employs a rules-driven, priority-based engine to allocate modules based on each student’s: Curricular needs; Seniority in the programme; and Module preferences. For more information, please refer to http://www.nus.edu.sg/ModReg/.

responses: You can make a declaration via the Education Records System (EduRec) (Navigation: Academics > Examinations > Submit S/U Declarations). Your S/U options declared will be final and irrevocable. Do take note of the deadline as you will not be allowed to declare the S/U option after the deadline.

patterns: How many su can i exercise

how many su am i given
what are the number of su i have

how many su can i carry over
responses:
Students may exercise S/U option for up to 32 MCs in the first two regular semesters; if this is not fully utilized, the S/U option may still be exercised in subsequent semesters, for up to 12 MCs. Variations on the limit of S/U options that can be exercised may apply for specific groups of students.

For more information, please visit http://www.nus.edu.sg/registrar/academic-activities/satisfactory-unsatisfactory-(s-u)-option

patterns: When will I be informed that I have been shortlisted for interviews or tests
how do i know if im shortlisted
how will i be informed if im shortlisted
how will i know that i have been shortlisted for an interview
how do i know that i have been shortlisted
responses:
Students who have applied for admission to Architecture, Dentistry, Industrial Design, Landscape Architecture, Law, Medicine and/or Nursing will be notified via the Online Application Status Facility in end-March/April. As the shortlist notification will be released electronically, the electronic letter to attend interview/test will serve as the official document from the University. No hardcopy letter and email will be sent to you.

Please visit http://www.nus.edu.sg/oam/faculty-interviews-and-test-dates for more information.
